Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface Outbreak

All Superinterfaces:
Abstraction.Entity, Abstraction.HistoricalStateProvider<OutbreakHistory>, Cloneable, Serializable
@Modifiable public interface Outbreak extends Abstraction.Entity, Abstraction.HistoricalStateProvider<OutbreakHistory>, Cloneable
The central mutable container for an entire simulation instance.

An Outbreak holds all immutable or semi-immutable components of a single simulation run, including:

  • Configuration (SetupConfiguration, ExecutionConfiguration)
  • Population of Person agents
  • Social contact network (SocialRelationship)
  • Baseline parameters (OutbreakBaseline)
  • Current state (OutbreakState) and history (OutbreakHistory)
  • System-wide policy state machine (StateMachine)

This class is mutable by design to support efficient in-place updates during the simulation loop. However, all contained data (e.g., person states, config) are immutable or thread-safe, enabling safe parallel execution.

Lifecycle

  1. Setup: Created via createOutbreakStub(), then populated with people and social network by DefaultNetworkSetup
  2. Baselining: Immutable baseline parameters (e.g., R₀-calibrated transmission) are computed once via DefaultOutbreakBaseliner
  3. Initialization: Initial state (time=0) is set via DefaultOutbreakInitialiser
  4. Execution: Updated daily by Updater, which advances time, processes contacts/exposures, and updates states/history

Thread Safety

  • Reads from multiple threads are safe (e.g., during contact network traversal)
  • Writes occur only during the sequential update cycle (one thread per simulation)
  • Ephemeral fields (getNextState(), getNextHistory()) are used exclusively during the update cycle to stage next-day values

  • Method Details

    • createOutbreakStub

      static io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak createOutbreakStub()
      Factory method to create a minimal, unconfigured outbreak stub.

      Used internally during simulation setup. Callers should use ExecutionBuilder instead.

      Returns:
      a new Outbreak instance with empty state/history and stubbed state machine

    • equality

      default boolean equality(Object another)
      underride equality to compare outbreak instances by their hash codes, which are random and unique per instance
      Parameters:
      another - the object to compare with this outbreak
      Returns:
      true if the other object is an Outbreak with the same hash code, false otherwise

    • getAverageNetworkDegree

      default double getAverageNetworkDegree()
      Average network degree across all agents accounting for undirected edges.
      Returns:
      average degree

    • getBaseline

      OutbreakBaseline getBaseline()
      Calibrated baseline parameters computed once at simulation start.

      Includes R₀-derived transmission probability, severity cutoffs, and infectivity profile. Never changes during simulation.

      Returns:
      outbreak baseline parameters

    • getCurrentHistory

      default Optional<OutbreakHistory> getCurrentHistory()
      Returns the most recent historical state (same as current state during update cycle).
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the most recent OutbreakHistory, or empty if history is empty

    • getCurrentState

      OutbreakState getCurrentState()
      Current state of the outbreak at this simulation time.

      Immutable snapshot containing prevalence, hospitalisations, mobility, and other aggregate metrics. Replaced entirely each timestep.

      Returns:
      current outbreak state

    • getExecutionConfiguration

      ExecutionConfiguration getExecutionConfiguration()
      Configuration defining disease dynamics, behaviour, and policy.

      Immutable after initialization. Includes in-host model, R₀, testing strategy, and policy triggers.

      Returns:
      execution configuration

    • getHistory

      List<OutbreakHistory> getHistory()
      Reverse-time-ordered list of historical outbreak states.

      Most recent entry (index 0) corresponds to getCurrentState(). Length is capped to ~2× infectious period to limit memory use.

      Specified by:
      getHistory in interface Abstraction.HistoricalStateProvider<OutbreakHistory>
      Returns:
      list of outbreak history entries, ordered from most recent to oldest

    • getNextHistory

      Ephemeral<io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakHistory.Builder> getNextHistory()
      Ephemeral builder for the next day's outbreak history.

      Only non-null during the update cycle. Used to accumulate daily summaries (e.g., test counts, incidence) before finalizing into getHistory().

      Returns:
      ephemeral builder for next outbreak history

    • getNextState

      Ephemeral<io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder> getNextState()
      Ephemeral builder for the next day's outbreak state.

      Only non-null during the update cycle (between prepareUpdate() and switchState()). Cleared after each timestep. Used to stage the next outbreak state before finalizing into getCurrentState() and appending to getHistory().

      Returns:
      ephemeral builder for next outbreak state

    • getPeople

      ThreadSafeArray<Person> getPeople()
      Thread-safe array of all agents in the simulation.

      Size is fixed at setup time and equals getPopulationSize(). Indexed by agent ID (0-based).

      Returns:
      thread-safe array of Person agents

    • getPersonById

      default Optional<Person> getPersonById(int id)
      Retrieve a person by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the person's ID
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the Person if found, or empty if not found

    • getPersonHistoryByIdAndTime

      default Optional<PersonHistory> getPersonHistoryByIdAndTime(int id, int time)
      Retrieves a specific agent's state at a given simulation time.
      Parameters:
      id - agent ID
      time - simulation day
      Returns:
      the agent's history record for that day, or Optional.empty() if not found

    • getPopulationSize

      default int getPopulationSize()
      Total number of agents in the simulation.

      Derived from setupConfig.getNetwork().getNetworkSize().

      Returns:
      population size

    • getSetupConfiguration

      SetupConfiguration getSetupConfiguration()
      Configuration defining population structure and contact network.

      Immutable after setup. Includes demographic model (e.g., age-stratified) and network generator (e.g., Erdős–Rényi).

      Returns:
      setup configuration

    • getSocialNetwork

      ThreadSafeArray<SocialRelationship> getSocialNetwork()
      Social contact network as a thread-safe array of weighted edges.

      Each SocialRelationship defines a potential contact between two agents, with strength modulated by demographics (e.g., age, proximity).

      Returns:
      thread-safe array of social relationships representing the contact network this will have been finalised at setup time and will not change during the simulation, but is thread-safe to allow concurrent reads during contact processing

    • getStateMachine

      StateMachine getStateMachine()
      System-wide policy state machine.

      Manages transitions between policy states (e.g., MONITOR ↔ LOCKDOWN in ReactiveLockdown).

      Returns:
      policy state machine

    • getUrn

      String getUrn()
      Unique identifier for this simulation run.

      Format: urnBase:setupName:setupReplica:execName:execReplica. Used for logging, output filenames, and random seed derivation.

      Specified by:
      getUrn in interface Abstraction.Entity
      Returns:
      unique URN string

    • hash

      @Derived default int hash()
      underride hash code
      Returns:
      a random hash code for this outbreak instance

    • print

      default String print()
      underride toString to return the outbreak's URN for easier identification in logs and outputs
      Returns:
      the URN of this outbreak instance
